title: Introducing: Cavan Moran
content:
Manchester’s Cavan Moran must be influenced by Bright Eyes. The songwriting similarities are rather eerie at times, most prominently found within the vocal delivery and the eloquent lyricism. That said, with Conor Oberst being one of my favourite musicians of all time, I’m a sucker for charming poetry and Americana inspired vocals. Until The End, the opening track of his debut EP is a fine example of insightful, heart-warming songwriting. A love song that finds Moran in his absolute element, gushing ‘i’ve told you before and I’ll tell you again, from the top of my lungs to the tip of my pen’, a line that Oberst himself would be proud of.

In an age of counterfeit songwriters (here’s looking at you Ed Sheeran), it’s rewarding and refreshing to hear such genuine, intelligent compositions. Acoustic driven music can often fall rather flat, but in the case of Cavan Moran he finds the balance between expressing personality and maintaining an admirable sense of realism.
